level.text: By October 1 of the next succeeding tax year, the Commission shall present to the Council and the Mayor a report on its operations for the tax year.
The report shall include the following:
The total number of appeals decided by the Commission;
A breakdown of appeals decided by class of property as those classes are defined in D.C. Official Code § 47-813 (2012 Supp.), stating the following for each class:
The total number of assessments sustained;
The total number of assessments increased;
The total number of assessments decreased;
The percentage of the increased, decreased, and sustained assessments;
The gain and loss in assessed value;
The revenue gain to the District as a result of the increases by the tax year;
The total revenue loss as a result of the decreases by the tax year; and
The total net revenue impact as a result of the Commission’s decisions;
An analysis of the Commission’s operations for the year, including identification of any problems and recommendations for dealing with those problems; and
A listing of the number of hours worked, and the total amount of compensation paid, for each member.
